content.text:
# Analysis of the Main Target Image

## Count & Layers
The target structure consists of 5 blocks arranged in 3 layers:
- Bottom layer: 1 yellow horizontal rectangular block
- Middle layer: 1 green vertical rectangular block on the left side and 2 cube blocks stacked (blue on top, red on bottom) on the right side
- Top layer: 1 yellow horizontal rectangular block

## Spatial Relationships
- The bottom yellow block serves as a base for the entire structure
- On the middle layer, the green vertical block is positioned on the left side
- The blue and red cubes are stacked vertically on the right side of the middle layer
- The top yellow block spans across both the green block and the blue cube, connecting them

# Selected Blocks from the Dictionary

Based on the target structure, I need the following blocks:
- 2 yellow horizontal rectangular blocks (for top and bottom) - matching blocks #11 or #12 
- 1 green vertical rectangular block - matching block #8
- 1 blue cube - matching block #1
- 1 red cube - matching block #3

Looking more carefully at the orientation, I'll select:
- Block #11 (yellow horizontal rectangular block) for top and bottom layers
- Block #8 (green vertical rectangular block)
- Block #1 (blue cube)
- Block #3 (red cube)

# Assembly Order

```
{
  Step1: Move block with index 11
  Step2: Move block with index 8
  Step3: Move block with index 1
  Step4: Move block with index 3
  Step5: Move block with index 11
}
```
